New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest Angels pitcher since Francisco Rodríguez in 2002 and the club’s youngest starting pitcher since Frank Tanana in 1973.
Key Match Events: Caden Dana made his Major League debut against the Mariners in a 3-2 win.
Dana fired a quality start, allowing two runs on two hits, four strikeouts, and four walks.
Dana recorded his first career strikeout against Cal Raleigh with a 95.1 mph four-seamer.
Dana limited Seattle to a Luke Raley solo homer in the second and Victor Robles’ sacrifice fly in the third.
Dana worked out of a jam in the fifth inning with two-out walks but recovered to strike out Robles.
Dana received a standing ovation from Angels fans after working out of another jam in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Dana mentioned the challenge of keeping his mindset in the tough environment before his debut.
Dana did extensive research on the Mariners' lineup before his debut, which impressed catcher Matt Thaiss.
Post-Match Reflections: Dana expressed nervousness but felt relieved after his first pitch.
Dana's parents and high school coaches expressed immense pride and emotional reactions to his debut.
Dana's mother reflected on his hard work and rapid progression to the Major Leagues.
Dana's father described the experience as surreal and emotional.
Dana's high school coaches shared their pride and confidence in his abilities.
